raw_text:
Bridge could miss rest of season
 
 Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge could miss the rest of the season with a suspected broken ankle.
 
 The England international, 24, was hurt in an innocuous challenge with Alan Shearer during the Londoners' FA Cup defeat at Newcastle on Sunday. "We think it's a big injury," said Jose Mourinho, whose Chelsea team this week meet Barcelona in the Champions League and Liverpool in the Carling Cup final. William Gallas and Damien Duff could also miss the Barcelona game. France defender Gallas and Ireland winger Duff both picked up their injuries in the closing stages of Chelsea's 1-0 defeat at St James' Park.
 
 With Bridge having gone off after Mourinho used all three substitutes, those knocks plus Carlo Cudicini's red card meant Chelsea finished the game with seven able-bodied players. Cudicini would not have played against Barcelona, but had been promised a game in the Carling Cup final, although he will now miss the Cardiff showpiece through suspension. The manager is not planning to add any new names to his squad ahead of the trip to Barcelona, even though he has few options to replace Bridge at left-back.
 
 Celestine Babayaro left the club in January, ironically to join Newcastle, and although Gallas has deputised at left-back before, he is struggling to be fit himself. It could be that Paulo Ferreira, usually a right-back, is switched to left-back with Glen Johnson, who ended the Newcastle game in goal, playing on the right. Youngsters Ben Hudell, Joe Keenan and Sam Tillen would be options should Mourinho decide to call up a replacement, but it is unlikely he would risk an untried prospect in a Champions League tie. Bridge's injury also means Mourinho, who reportedly wants to sign Ashley Cole from Arsenal, will not have a specialist, senior left-back for the run-in to the season.
 
 "He (Bridge) has no chance of playing against Barcelona, probably will not play against Liverpool (in the Carling Cup final) and maybe not for the rest of the season," he said. "The medical department will try to do everything to recover Gallas and Duff. We will have to wait and see, but I won't cry about injuries because we will have 11 players to play on Tuesday." Shearer said he was unsure what caused Bridge's injury. "I don't know what happened." he said. "It was just a shame. I don't think we even touched each other. "By all accounts it's pretty serious. I went into the dressing-room after the game and wished him all the best." Mourinho, whose team are chasing three trophies, has already lost winger Arjen Robben to a serious injury.
llama3.2:1b: Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge is suspected to have broken his ankle and could miss the rest of the season. He suffered an injury in a game against Newcastle on Sunday, which led to Manchester City's Carlo Cudicini being sent off. The manager has already lost William Gallas and Damien Duff to injuries in the past.
llama3.2:3b: Wayne Bridge may miss the rest of the season with a suspected broken ankle. Jose Mourinho believes it's a big injury and Bridge will not play against Barcelona or possibly Liverpool in the Carling Cup final. The manager is unlikely to add new names to his squad, leaving Paulo Ferreira as an option at left-back.
gemma2:2b: Chelsea's Wayne Bridge is likely out for the rest of the season with a suspected broken ankle.  This leaves Chelsea with few options at left-back, especially with important matches against Barcelona and Liverpool looming. Jose Mourinho will play without Bridge, Gallas or Duff against Barcelona, potentially relying on right-back Paulo Ferreira to fill in.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Chelsea striker Wayne Bridge is expected to miss part of the 2018-2019 English Premier League season due to a suspected ankle injury during their friendly match against Newcastle United on Sunday. Bridge left-back Gallas and Duff are also affected by injuries, with France defender Gallas being out for up to seven days and Ireland winger Duff being sidelined through suspension. The team's goalkeeping duo, Carlo Cudicini (right) and Paulo Ferreira (left), have been called up but will not play against Barcelona due to the absence of Bridge. Bridge's injury is expected to prevent him from playing against Liverpool in the Carling Cup final or for the rest of the season. The team has a few options to replace the injured players, with Ashley Cole and Gordon Gannon potentially returning if Mourinho decides to call up a specialist left-back.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Chelsea defender Wayne Bridge is likely to miss most of this season with a suspected broken ankle, potentially preventing him from participating in the Champions League match against Barcelona and the Carling Cup final. The club's manager has indicated they will not add any new players to the squad for upcoming matches due to limited options at left-back after injuries to William Gallas, Damien Duff, Paulo Ferreira, Glen Johnson, and Celestine Babayaro.
qwen2.5:3b: Wayne Bridge could miss the rest of the season with a suspected broken ankle. Chelsea face potential absences for key players like Gallas, Duff, and Cudicini in their upcoming matches against Barcelona and Liverpool due to Bridge's injury. Mourinho is unsure about Bridge's return but expects medical staff to do everything possible to get Gallas and Duff fit again.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Chelsea's missing Wayne Bridge because of an ankle injury. Let me read through it carefully.

The first sentence says Chelsea could miss the rest of the season if Wayne Bridge misses due to a broken ankle. He was an English international at 24 and had a serious challenge with Alan Shearer during their FA Cup game against Newcastle on Sunday. Mourinho, who plays Chelsea this week against Barcelona and Liverpool, mentioned that his substitutions include those players who missed because of the injury.

Then it talks about other injuries: Gallas and Duff from France and Ireland were injured in the closing stages of a 1-0 loss to St James' Park. Cudicini got a red card but isn't playing against Barcelona yet, so he won't play in the Champions League final either. The manager is probably considering a rotation with Bridge out, maybe not adding new players.

Celestine Babayaro left the club in January for Newcastle and hasn't fit in there, though Gallas has been at left-back before but struggling. Sometimes Paulo Ferreira from right-back might switch to left-back, which could mean someone else is there. There are options for young players like Ben Hudell, Joe Keenan, or Sam Tillen. But it's unlikely Mourinho would take on a tried-out prospect in the Champions League.

Bridge's injury means Mourinho won't have a specialist at left-back during the season, even though he wants to sign Ashley Cole from Arsenal, who might be ready later. Shearer is unsure what caused Bridge's injury, but it was "shameful."

The manager's team is chasing three trophies, lost Arjen Robben to serious injury earlier, and Chelsea still has other injuries.

I need to make sure I include all key points: who could miss, Gallas and Duff's status, Cudicini's situation, the manager's plan, and what else is happening with Celestine and Ferreira.
</think>

Chelsea could miss the rest of the season if Wayne Bridge, an English international at 24, misses due to a broken ankle. He was part of a 1-0 loss against Newcastle during their FA Cup game on Sunday, where Mourinho mentioned his substitutions included players who missed because of the injury. Gallas and Duff from France and Ireland were also injured in the game. Cudicini got a red card but isn't playing against Barcelona, though he will miss the Cardiff showpiece. Mourinho plans to use Bridge out during the trip to Barcelona, even without a specialist, as they face three trophies. Gallas has fit in left-back before but is struggling. Paulo Ferreira might switch to left-back with Glen Johnson, and there are options for young players. The injury means Mourinho won't have a tried-back specialist this season, though shearer remains unsure of the cause.
tinyllama:1.1b: The English soccer club Chelsea may have a shortage of options in their squad ahead of the upcoming Champions League game against Barcelona due to injuries suffered by key defenders Wayne Bridge and Damien Duff, who picked up two knocks in the final minutes of their 1-0 defeat at Newcastle United. The injuries also threaten to rule out senior left-back Paul Gallas from a possible start at Barcelona on Thursday. Chelsea coach Jose Moulinho has been planning to name new names to his squad but may have to make do with the remaining seven players in their lineup, with injured fullbacks Gary Caldwell and John Terry expected to miss out. The club's management will not add any new names ahead of the Carlisle United showdown, though they could be forced to switch between left-backs Ben Hudell and Joe Keena/Sam Tillen if midfielder Paul McGrath suffers a hamstring injury. Chelsea has already lost top attacker Arjen Robben for three trophies, meaning the team may need to rely on their younger players like midfielders Ben Hudell, Glen Johnson, and Ashley Cole, as well as defenders Gary Caldwell and John Terry, to help bridge the gap between them and Liverpool.
tinydolphin:1.1b: In summary, Bridge is likely to miss the rest of the season with a fractured ankle after being hurt in an FA Cup challenge against Newcastle's Alan Shearer. Chelsea will likely need to explore options for their midfield and look at bringing in a replacement while they wait for Gallas' recovery.
phi:2.7b: Chelsea's left-back Wayne Bridge may be out for the rest of the season due to a suspected broken ankle suffered during a challenge with Alan Shearer in their FA Cup defeat at Newcastle on Sunday. Bridge is not expected to play against Barcelona in the Champions League, but will still have to face Liverpool in the Carling Cup final. Mourinho has few options to replace Bridge and is considering calling up an inexperienced player as a temporary solution. Chelsea's other key players Gallas and Duff also suffered injuries during the game, leaving the team with seven able-bodied players for their upcoming match against Barcelona. Meanwhile, Gallas has struggled to be fit since leaving the club in January and it may be that Paulo Ferreira, usually a right-back, will switch positions with Glen Johnson, who ended Newcastle's game in goal. Mourinho has also lost winger Arjen Robben to an injury, making Bridge'a potential challenge for the title even more significant.
orca-mini:3b: Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge could miss the rest of the season with a suspected broken ankle after being hurt in an innocuous challenge with Alan Shearer during the Londoners' FA Cup defeat at Newcastle on Sunday. The England international, 24, was hurt and it seems unlikely he will play for the rest of the season. His injuries could affect teammate Gallas and Ireland winger Duff. However, Mourinho has few options to replace him and plans not to add any new names to his squad ahead of the trip to Barcelona.
hermes3:3b: Wayne Bridge likely to miss rest of season with suspected broken ankle; Chelsea may use substitutes like Paulo Ferreira or young players Ben Hudell etc for replacement.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge might miss the rest of the season due to a suspected broken ankle sustained during an FA Cup match against Newcastle. Jose Mourinho's team could also be without William Gallas and Damien Duff for their Champions League clash with Barcelona. Although young players like Ben Hudell, Joe Keenan, and Sam Tillen might be options for replacements, it is unlikely Mourinho would risk an untried prospect in a Champions League tie. Bridge's injury leaves the team without a specialist, senior left-back for the remainder of the season.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge may miss the rest of the season due to a suspected broken ankle sustained in an FA Cup defeat to Newcastle. Manager Jose Mourinho confirmed the severity of the injury and also faces potential absences of William Gallas and Damien Duff for the upcoming Champions League match against Barcelona. Chelsea finished the Newcastle game with only seven fit players after injuries and a red card to Carlo Cudicini, who will now miss the Carling Cup final. With no natural left-back available, Mourinho may have to reshuffle his defense, possibly using Paulo Ferreira on the left. Despite the setbacks, Mourinho remains focused on competing for three trophies, though he has already lost Arjen Robben to injury. Alan Shearer, involved in the challenge with Bridge, expressed regret but was unsure how the injury occurred.
stablelm2:1.6b: Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge may miss the rest of the season due to a suspected broken ankle, after being injured during a FA Cup match against Newcastle United. Potential injuries for upcoming games include William Gallas and Ireland winger Damien Duff, both of whom were substituted in the game due to their own injuries. Jose Mourinho will have limited options to replace Bridge at left-back, with the potential to use younger players Ben Hudell, Joe Keenan, and Sam Tillen if necessary. Bridge's injury also means that Mourinho won't have a senior left-back for the remainder of the season. Gallas and Duff are currently struggling to be fit themselves, possibly due to being deputized at left-back before. The medical department is working to recover Gallas and Duff, while waiting and seeing how Bridge recovers from his injury.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge, 24, is likely to miss the remainder of the season after suffering a suspected broken ankle during an innocuous challenge with Alan Shearer in their FA Cup match against Newcastle on Sunday. The injury occurred when Bridge was substituted due to Mourinho using all available substitutes. Teammates William Gallas and Damien Duff also sustained injuries during the game, potentially ruling them out for the upcoming Champions League clash with Barcelona and the Carling Cup final against Liverpool. With only seven fit players left after the match, Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is not planning to add new signings to his squad. Instead, Gallas may deputize at left-back, possibly alongside Glen Johnson on the right, or be switched to that position from his usual role as a center-back. Younger players Ben Hudell, Joe Keenan, and Sam Tillen could be considered for the bench but are unlikely to start due to their inexperience. Mourinho's desire to sign Ashley Cole from Arsenal is further complicated by Bridge's injury, as he would provide a specialist left-back option. The manager remains optimistic about having 11 players for the Barcelona match, emphasizing that he won't be overly concerned about injuries affecting their chances of winning multiple trophies this season.
reference: "We think it's a big injury," said Jose Mourinho, whose Chelsea team this week meet Barcelona in the Champions League and Liverpool in the Carling Cup final."He (Bridge) has no chance of playing against Barcelona, probably will not play against Liverpool (in the Carling Cup final) and maybe not for the rest of the season," he said.William Gallas and Damien Duff could also miss the Barcelona game.Shearer said he was unsure what caused Bridge's injury.Cudicini would not have played against Barcelona, but had been promised a game in the Carling Cup final, although he will now miss the Cardiff showpiece through suspension.Mourinho, whose team are chasing three trophies, has already lost winger Arjen Robben to a serious injury.Chelsea left-back Wayne Bridge could miss the rest of the season with a suspected broken ankle.Bridge's injury also means Mourinho, who reportedly wants to sign Ashley Cole from Arsenal, will not have a specialist, senior left-back for the run-in to the season.The manager is not planning to add any new names to his squad ahead of the trip to Barcelona, even though he has few options to replace Bridge at left-back.France defender Gallas and Ireland winger Duff both picked up their injuries in the closing stages of Chelsea's 1-0 defeat at St James' Park.
